column4: just wrirte you problem and lets see then if anyone can help you out
because I did not safely remove an USB flash drive before shutting down my computer ... and then removed it after shutting down ... my computer now does not complete startup ...
I think it is trying to read the USB flash drive.  I plugged it back in, but it is still having the same problem ...
trying to read the flash drive upon startup, I mean ..
I ment to ask the crowed, not me ;)
Can anyone help me with my problem?

When I startup my IBM Thinkpad (running strictly Ubuntu) it is trying to read a USB flash drive that was not "safely removed" before shutting down last time ... and then USB drive was physically removed after shutting down ...
Do I have to manipulate something in the BIOS settings to get it to properly startup again?
I would really appreciate anyone's help!
I really sucks that currently I cannot use my computer because of this stupid problem ...
OK, I'm not getting any responses.  Is there a better channel to ask this question in?
I would check the BIOS settings for the first boot device and change that in case mtnman80
no mtnman80 its is the right channel, but maybe not the best time
OK, let me tell you the choices I have in the BIOS settings ... and see if you can help properly order the devices that the system references when starting up ...
